message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.DL

The paper proposes a novel topic model for scientific documents that jointly generates mathematical equations and their surrounding text. The paper uses a corpus of 400K equation-context pairs extracted from a range of scientific articles from arXiv. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language) which deals with natural language processing and computational linguistics. The paper also uses a variational autoencoder approach which is commonly used in machine learning and deep learning, indicating that it could also belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.DL (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). The paper also discusses topic inference and alignment of mathematical symbols and words, indicating that it could belong to cs.IR (Information Retrieval) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence).
